conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change in location and size when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow A corresponds to the birdcage.
Shadow A moves closer to the birdcage when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow A becomes smaller when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow B corresponds to the matchbox and matches.
Shadow B shifts closer to the matchbox and matches when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow B becomes smaller when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow C corresponds to the lamp.
Shadow C moves closer to the lamp when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow C becomes smaller when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow D corresponds to the dagger.
Shadow D moves closer to the dagger when the light source moves backwards.
Shadow D becomes smaller when the light source moves backwards.
When the light source moves backward, the distance between the objects and the light source increases.
Increased distance causes shadows to shorten because the angle at which the light hits the objects becomes less steep.
Increased distance causes shadows to shift closer to their respective objects because the shadows project less far.

Final Answer: Shadow A moves closer to the birdcage and becomes smaller; Shadow B moves closer to the matchbox and matches and becomes smaller; Shadow C moves closer to the lamp and becomes smaller; Shadow D moves closer to the dagger and becomes smaller.
